reviews.text: All in all I like this hotel, its clean nice and doesn't have that hookers in the lobby feel you hear about in many of the hotels here in Russia. I found the breakfast bar to be great. Every morning they have a very wide selection of food, 2-3 types of sausage, bacon, eggs (scrambled and hard boiled) assorted lunch meats, fresh fruit, a couple of different yogurts and cottage cheese. They also have porridge or cream of wheat or cream of rice (it seems to rotate) as well. Also some fried mushrooms, cucumbers/or squash, tomatoes etc. They also have 3 or 4 types of cereals, russian pancakes or the one which is like a crepe made into a burrito with kurds (cottage cheese) inside coffee or tea etc. I did find its better to go earlier in the morning as when I went on Saturday some of the warm food had been sitting in the warming trays too long (a little over cooked sausage for example) but I went right before they closed at 10:45 am. They close on weekdays at 10AM. There is free Wifi and it seems to work pretty well, a small bar in the lobby and another one called the library on the 8th floor, but I went there on Thursday night and it appeared to be closed (although the sign said it would be open form 8PM on-wards. Ordering a taxi here is a little bit more expensive but from what I can tell its not a completed gouging, they charge 600 Rubles for 30 minutes 950 for an hour, I heard some guys picked up a taxi on the street one day and got charged a 1000 Rubles for a 10 minute ride. So at least you know what your getting I guess. They charged me 1900R from SVO airport to the hotel, which was about 1.5 hours with the traffic. Otherwise the room is a little small and definitely has that IKEA feel to it, OK furniture but not super fancy either. Free mini bar is nice (two bottle water with gas, two without, and two cokes and two juices every day, also some potato chips and small chocolate bar and peanuts. I have raided it every day and they refill it the next. The lobby staff have been very helpful and everyone understand English. Also due to working late a couple of nights I ordered room service 3X's, and all in all it was a little expensive but pretty good food. I didn't like the swedish canepe's so much (a little too fishy) but the borcht was fine, the blinis and russian pelemeni were good as well. I thought the chicken sandwich was ok but it was made with minced meat, and I would prefer a normal chicken breast, but it wast horrible. So all in all I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Katerina, but do not expect a real luxury hotel, but its a big step above a tourist hotel as well. Somewhere in between, I would compare to a courtyard or a doubletree in the USA. Price wise from what I compared here in moscow it seems to be a reasonable deal, but its not cheap either. Keep in mind though Moscow is way overpriced for hotels.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Good Location, Seems Pricey but this is Moscow

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay in Katerina City hotel. It offers good service and we enjoyed the extensive breakfast buffet. The hotel location is perfect; 5 minutes walk to Paveletskaya (metro)station, which also provides the direct train to DME airport. With the metro it is only a few metrostops to Belorusskaya station for the direct train to SVO.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location

reviews.text: Though the rooms are nice and quiet, they are also getting a bit old. Furniture and carpet is worn and not always fully clean. The hotel should renovate them to keep living up to the good reviews.
reviews.title: Very good location, friendly and fair value

reviews.text: Main booking priorities were:-
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, great service, great breakfast, great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - near Pavletski Voxal (the station you at arrive at by cheap and quick train from Moscow Domodedevo DME)
reviews.title: Excellent friendly service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is extremely convenient to the AeroExpress from/to DME and the green line of the Moscow metro. The daily breakfast at the hotel is extensive, diverse and excellent. The bar/restaurant is convenient and has a friendly vibe. The staff of the hotel are friendly and helpful. The rooms are OK, small, barely adequate for two persons, but adequate nonetheless. Although the bathrooms are small, the shower has adequate pressure and hot water. We did not use the workout space, sauna or steam, but appreciated having it available.
reviews.title: Convenient and a good value.

reviews.text: Stayed here a couple of times now when I've been here on business and would stay here again. Contacted the hotel before I arrived and they organised a taxi to pick me up at the airport. They are also happy to organise all taxi's for the stay and put them on the one bill at the end.
reviews.title: Good hotel in a good location

reviews.text: Rooms are small, but have everything you need. The free minibar with soft drinks and snacks is a nice touch too. The hotel is modern and the furniture looks like it's straight out of an Ikea showroom! The food is good too and suits all tastes.
reviews.title: Good hotel with relatively fair prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are friendly and happy to assist. Also there are a couple of pc's downstairs in the bar area that you can use.
reviews.title: Very strange booking service

reviews.text: Location is pretty good, you can walk to the metro or to the railway station in about 5 minutes and it takes no time to get into the centre. If you do go by metro, take notice of the decor in the stations as they are worth seeing.
reviews.title: Good location and nice room

reviews.text: Great hotel, the staff was very friendly and the receptionists smiled every time we approached them (not a usual thing for Moscow). Perfect location, only two quick metro stops from the Kremlin, you can also walk to the city centre and reach the Red square in about 20 minutes. To get the best rates it is better to approach a reliable tour operator or an agent, otherwise your stay in Moscow will be very expensive. If you are based in the UK, try Go Russia travel group. By the way, the hotel offers free minibar, that was really incredible!
reviews.title: Great location and friendly staff. Free minibar, wifi and fitness centre - just incredible!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean and tidy hotel for a good price. Very good service which is rare in Russia. I really recommend this hotel for any kind of guest.
reviews.title: Choose this hotel if you want good service to a good price

reviews.text: The Katerina City is well placed, clean and friendly. Everyone was helpful, particularly the restaurant and bar staff who were very attentive, with nothing being too much trouble. The food is excellent and varied and there is a free mini bar and breakfast with a choice of foods to suit every taste.
reviews.title: The Katerina city is a great all rounder

reviews.text: I would love to stay here again if I am ever in Moscow again.
reviews.title: Good serice and ambience

reviews.text: We hade a very good stay at the hotel. The service was pleasant and professional (which I undertstand is not always the case in other Moscow hotels I have heard) The hotel is pleasant and the location along the river gives breathing space in this vast city. /Christian
reviews.title: Will stay again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: in town near Metro, rooms and lift silent, minibar free, breakfast excellent, friendly atmosphere, internet free, helpful service
reviews.title: a very good hotel with everything needed

reviews.text: I am regularly staying on Katerina since more than 5 years - it provides good value for money, walking distance to metro and railway Pavaletskaya connecting to Demodedovo Airport and a quiet environment in the center of Moscow.
reviews.title: Good option for business and private trip

reviews.text: This hotel was ideally located when I arrived via BA flight in southern Moscow. The airport express was clean, spacious and cheap - taking only 45 minutes. Katerina City is a short walk round the corner from the station. I was welcomed into the hotel by friendly English-speaking staff and soon took advantage of the free wi-fi that works in public areas as well as in the rooms. Although the hotel is a little dated in design, small touches such as the free mini-bar included in the room rate more than compensated. Although the hotel is not located right in the city centre it is next to two metro lines - offering quick and cheap access to the rest of the city. 'Downtown' Moscow - i.e. Red Square is reached in two stops. Restaurants and bars around Pushkin Square are just 3 stops. The circle line connects you pretty much with anywhere.
reviews.title: Great base in the city centre

reviews.text: The staff in the hotel were very friendly and this small hotel is a welcome change from the over-priced arrogance of some other properties in Moscow!!!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for the business traveller- great location and superb facilities and staff!

reviews.text: I stayed at Katerina City as part of a business trip to Moscow and was really impressed by the hotel and the helpful and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, a little far from city center

reviews.text: Whilst being a bit of a walk from Red Square, it is near to the Paveletskaya station and the Metro which will take you to the centre. The surrounding area is a bit quiet, but it is next to the river, so is pleasant enough.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, convenient location

reviews.text: The hotel itself is very good, the staff were very accommodating, and the facilities were good - free internet, gym/sauna, bar and restaurant. The rooms, whilst slightly smaller than average, were perfectly comfortable and had air-conditioning.
reviews.title: Best value for the rates you pay in Moscow !

reviews.text: Would definitely consider staying again on a return to Moscow.
reviews.title: Extremely Pleasant Experience

reviews.text: Stayed at the Katerina Hotel for a week at the end of June and was very pleasantly suprised. I noticed very competive price offers from other hotels, but on closer inspection the rates that appear "cheaper" do not include what Katerina offers.
reviews.title: Would stay there again any time.

reviews.text: First: VAT is included in the rate: most hotels offer their rates excluding VAT (which marks up their rate with 18% on checkout).
reviews.title: one of the best value options

reviews.text: Spent two nights at the hotel as I attended a conference at the Riverside Towers, just next door (300 meters) . It was my first visit to Russia, so it is difficult to compare with other hotels. Anyhow, from what I heard about hotels in Moscow, this is a nice, clean and comfortable place to stay at an affordable price. I had a room facing a quiet backyard. Room was modern, Swedish style, well equipped, television with CNN, BBC, TVE, etc., unique is the free of charge minibar with 1.5 liters of mineral water and a bottle of bear and some snacks. There is no coffee maker and no ironing board, but slippers. Bathroom amenities are at the lower end, water pressure on shower weak, but sufficient. Bed was comfortable, air condition , i.e. heating quite and good. Breakfast buffet was very good and nourishing (International, but with Russian character, that means plentiful). Staff at reception is friendly and attentive, they speak fluent English. Bar on the top floor was closed, a pity, as there is a nice view of the city up there. lobby bar is not very atmospheric. Otherwise, there is no entertainment. The hotel is a place to regenerate and relax, oh yes, there was a sauna in the base floor (I didn't visit). If you are a smoker, you will be glad to hear that smoking is permitted in various areas of the hotel, e.g. there is a secluded section in the restaurant for smokers. And a hint (has nothing to do with the hotel), if you travel in winter, take really good, snow and ice proof shoes with you, and warm clothes. The wind on the nearby bridges chills you to the bone.
reviews.title: Conveniant Riverside Location and Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: the hotel is just in front of the imposing Swisshotel. There is not too much around and if you want to walk to the Red Square is quite a walk. Rooms are not very big and simple but clean, Swedish management is an advantage there. We could not get the taxi we requested the night before, be sure you book in advance and get confirmation!
reviews.title: good location for business

reviews.text: Good, clean, friendly hotel close to main metro lines. Reception staff are superb and extremely helpful.
reviews.title: SSHHHH, keep this one a secret otherwise you'll never get in!!

reviews.text: Fill in the happy sheet and the hotel manager will email you straight away whether your opinions were good or bad and especially if you had any negative thoughts. They will act on any concerns you have.
reviews.title: Grumpy businessman unexpectedly impressed!

reviews.text: Free mini-bar restocked every day and good internet connection.
reviews.title: Excellent value, convenient, good service, good facilities - good bet for Moscow

reviews.text: Clean rooms, good location, good value for Russia. The breakfast was great. We ate a couple of meals in the hotel restaurant too and enjoyed it very much.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: This was the second time we stayed at Katerina City, a place we highly recommend. Quiet, well-managed, good rooms with all the comfort you want, free minibar (yes, really, free snacks, water and sodas), super breakfast, good location (10 min to the Paveletskaya metro station. The price was - for Moscow standars - very good. A "must" : have a drink on the 34th floor of the Swissotel, only a brief 10 minute walk away.
reviews.title: Top amenities, good rooms, good location - at a very good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a middle size, four-stars, swedish-style, non smoking hotel located near the heart of Moscau, approximately 2,5km from Kremlin, or 400m from the nearest metro station "Paveleckaja". Within easy distance of all the main attractions of this intersting city. The hotel has a quiet calm atmosphere a complete change from the busy city.It is located on the embankment ,of side-canal of river Moscau.
reviews.title: good hotel near the centre of Moscau

reviews.text: Rooms are very comfortable and clean with good beds/ I prefer harder/ . But in the bathroom surprised me a plastic curtain on the shower corner. During my showering the water was flowing out of this corner. on the floor of bathroom.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a good location

reviews.text: The staff on the reception spoke English very good and were very helpful, polite and very efficient providing information and advice when asked. But the young waiter's in the hotel restaurant had problem with English/only one young waitress could speak in English/. But I remembered some Russian word's- I have learnd it a 20 years ago in the ground- and high-school.
reviews.title: Friendly and great breakfast !

reviews.text: Great central location, easy to explore the city from here.
reviews.title: Central and good service

reviews.text: The room were nice and clean, maybe a bit small.
reviews.title: like a youth hostel
Good location for HP, Agilent, and Moscow Int. Perf. Center
reviews.text: The hotels staff were very helpfull, friendly and spoke engslish. Great service and tastefull food in the hotel restaurant Stockholm. We also hade some time to relax in the jacuzzi.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we heared a lot about the high hotel prices in Moscow and the Katerina-City Hotel was no exception. Even cheap, compared to other hotels in the same neighborhood, we were very disappointed about the configuration of the room. I've seen similar room in youth hostels...... Tiny, not enough towels, no safty box etc..... Next time in Moscow we'll spend some Rubels more!
reviews.title: 48 hours in Moscow

likes.liked: — The friendly staff and the restaurant

reviews.text: This hotel is right across the river from the HP and Agilent sales offices, as well as the Moscow International Performance Center. My colleague and I both found the walk to the Kremlin to be pleasant and not far at all. We also took the nearby Metro, which was an easy walk. There was much construction nearby, but that's Moscow for you.
reviews.title: Like being at home - but better
